segments.text: Hi sweetheart! Can you see me okay? The video link from up here can be a little choppy sometimes.
I can see you, Dad! You're floating! Are you really in space right now?
I really am. I'm 420 kilometers above Earth, traveling at 7.66 kilometers per second. We orbit the planet every 90 minutes.
That's so fast! Mom, Dad is going super fast in space!
I know, honey. Your dad is pretty amazing. How are you feeling, Chen? You look good.
I'm good. A little tired - we had an EVA this morning. But everyone's healthy, mission is going well.
What's an EVA? Is that like a spaceship thing?
EVA means Extra-Vehicular Activity. It's when astronauts put on spacesuits and go outside the space station to fix things.
You went OUTSIDE? In actual space? That's so cool! Were you scared?
Actually, I stayed inside today. Two of my crew members, Torres and Kim, did the spacewalk. I was their commander, making sure they stayed safe.
Did everything go okay? No problems?
Perfect execution. They replaced a broken antenna bracket in 87 minutes. Textbook operation.
Dad, can you show us your space station? I want to see where you sleep!
Sure! Let me turn the camera around. This is the Unity module where we eat and have meetings.
Everything is floating! Look Mom, there's a pen just floating in the air!
Yeah, we have to be careful not to lose things. If you let go of something, it just drifts away. See, I'll push this pen and it floats.
That's so cool! Can you do a flip?
A flip? Alright, watch this. I'll do a somersault for you.
Wow! You're upside down! No, now you're right-side up again! That's amazing!
Careful, don't make yourself dizzy. Mei, let your dad rest. He's been working hard.
I'm okay, really. I love showing Mei around. This is what it's all for - inspiring the next generation.
When I grow up, I want to be an astronaut just like you, Dad!
You can be anything you want, sweetie. Astronaut, scientist, teacher - whatever makes you happy. But you have to study hard and never give up.
I'm studying! I got an A on my science test about the solar system!
That's wonderful! I'm so proud of you. Tell me, what was your favorite thing you learned?
I learned that Jupiter has a big red spot that's actually a giant storm! And it's been going for hundreds of years!
That's right! The Great Red Spot. It's a storm bigger than Earth itself. Jupiter is incredible.
She talks about you constantly. Tells everyone her dad is in space. The other parents are very impressed.
How are you holding up, Lin? I know this isn't easy, me being gone for months.
We're managing. I miss you, of course. But I'm proud of what you're doing. And Mei helps keep me busy.
I miss you both so much. Sometimes at night I look down at Earth and think about you sleeping in our house.
We think about you too. Every night before bed, Mei looks for the space station in the sky.
I saw it yesterday! It was moving really fast across the sky like a bright star!
That was probably us! When we pass over at night, the sun reflects off the solar panels and makes us visible.
I waved at you! Did you see me waving?
I couldn't see you from up here, but I felt it in my heart. I always know when you're thinking about me.
When are you coming home? We're counting down the days.
Ninety-three days left. Three more months. It sounds like a long time, but it'll go fast with all the work we have scheduled.
Will you bring me something from space? Like a moon rock or a star?
I can't bring moon rocks, but I have a mission patch that's been in space with me. I'll give it to you when I get home.
Really? That's going to be the coolest thing ever! I'll show all my friends!
I'm glad. Listen, I have to go soon. We have a crew meeting in fifteen minutes. But I love you both so much.
We love you too. Stay safe up there. We'll talk again in a few days?
Absolutely. Same time, same channel. Mei, keep studying hard and being good for your mom, okay?
I will, Dad! Bye! I love you!
I love you too, sweetheart. Bye Lin. Miss you.

environment.background_sounds: ventilation hum, occasional video call static, equipment beeping
